definitions.definition: Shaped like a square ( the polygon ) .

subdefinitions.definition: Forming right angles in all planes as intended; not racked or leaning .
examples: The foundation has to be level and the framing has to be square .
labels: of box-shaped objects such as buildings or metal frames
subdefinitions.label_groups: of box-shaped objects such as buildings or metal frames

subdefinitions.definition: Forming right angles with the mast or the keel, and parallel to the horizon; said of the yards of a square-rigged vessel when they are so braced.

definitions.definition: Used in the names of units of area formed by multiplying a unit of length by itself.
examples: A floor that measures 4 feet square has an area of 16 square feet .
I'm just looking for a square deal on my car repair.

definitions.definition: Satisfied ; comfortable with; not experiencing any conflict .

examples: to make or leave the accounts square
The sides were square at the end of the half.

definitions.definition: In line with the batsman 's popping crease .

examples: It may be prison, but at least I'm getting three square meals a day.

definitions.definition: Having a shape broad for the height, with angular rather than curving outlines.
examples: a man of a square frame

definitions.definition: Of an internal combustion engine design, in which the diameter of the piston is similar, roughly, approximately, equal to its stroke distance.

main_definition: Shaped like a square ( the polygon ) .
secondary_definitions: Used in the names of units of area formed by multiplying a unit of length by itself.
Satisfied ; comfortable with; not experiencing any conflict .
( cricket ) In line with the batsman 's popping crease .
Having a shape broad for the height, with angular rather than curving outlines.
( automotive ) Of an internal combustion engine design, in which the diameter of the piston is similar, roughly, approximately, equal to its stroke distance.
